transcripts.text: Pope Julius II was originally pretty gung-ho, like, yeah, we're gonna fix the building, yeah, it's gonna be great.  And he gets this report and he's like, oh boy.  Yeah, get the bulldozers.
Everybody's a conservationist until they get the estimate.
Yeah, exactly.
He was just like, can we do the Vancouver thing, where we like, keep the front foot of the façade, and then just build a new thing behind it?  Oh, a façade!

There are some tiny bits of this basilica that are still around, but they're like, buried underneath.  I think there's like, parts of the crypt are still there, and some of the ornamentation was saved.
Ah, that's so cool.  I wanna do Lara Croft shit.  I wanna like, swing across a bunch of banners and ancient mechanisms and shit to find those.

So, Julius II commits to demolishing Old St.  Peter's, which is a major controversy in all of Christendom, because this is like an 1100-year-old building.  He also orders the Colosseum to be demolished to provide stone for the new church.  They don't quite get through with that one.
Isn't that why it's not symmetrical, still?  Why it's not like a big circle?  Because they just took a chunk off of the top?
That's a lot of Roman ruins, it's kinda like, yeah, we'll just use these as a quarry.
Hmm.  Very cool.  Very cool.
The difficult part about this is, okay, we gotta finance our new fancy church.  The new St.  Peter's Basilica.  How are we gonna finance it?
It pulls big button... big lever marked indulgences.  Yes.

We're gonna sell a shitload of indulgences, guys.  We're gonna sell so many fucking indulgences that we're gonna build the largest church the world will see for 500 years.  So that's what they did.  So...
Bidding process for architectural renovation gets out of hand.  Accidentally creates Protestantism.

So, in order to finance the new St.  Peters, they send out, y'know, various clergy, including a friar who goes to the town Martin Luther was in.  to sell all these indulgences. Yeah.  And of course Luther was this letter-writing crank.
Yes.  Yeah, he's a poster, but like... Dear Sir!  Dear Richard!
Why is this in green ink?
This letter became known as, um, this was Dispution of Martin Luther on the Power and Efficacy of Indulgences.  Jesus.  Or the Ninety-Five Theses.  Or the Ninety-Five Theses.
Just write one thesis.
Yeah, indulgences are dumb.  That's the one thesis.
Yeah, thesis one.  Fuck indulgences.  That's in 72 point fracture.
Everything else?
The Bible.
